page.title: 04CHILBOLTON OBSERVATORY
page.content: THIS IS OWNED BY THE SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING RESEARCH COUNCIL,AND IS AN OUT STATION OF THE RUTHERFORD -APPLETON LABORATORIES.IT WAS BUILT IN 1964-1967.IT IS USED FOR 1.TROPOSPHERIC RADIO PROPOGATION (HOW WELL RADIO WAVES TRAVEL THROUGH THE WEATHER) 2.MONITORING SCIENTIFIC SATELLITES. THE DISH IS 25M. IN DIAMETER AND WEIGHS 420 TONNES.2300 TONNES OF CONCRETE WERE USED IN THE BUILDING OF THE TOWER. THE MOVEMENT IS CONTROLLED BY G.E.C. COMPUTERS.THE DISH RESTS ON STEEL BALL BEARINGS AND CAN BE MOVED BY HAND. 12 SCIENTISTS AND ENGINEERS WORK THERE,BUT OTHER SCIENTISTS VISIT. THE TELESCOPE WAS BUILT ON THE DOWN BECAUSE IT IS SHIELDED BY THE HILLS FROM RADIO WAVES,FROM THE NEARBY TOWNS OF ANDOVER,STOCKBRIDGE AND WINCHESTER.
